data.title: Lunch
data.text: Authentic Indian cuisine though run by a Pakistani. The place is kind of seedy but the food is undeniably good.

data.title: Average
data.text:
My experience here was sub-optimal as a result of the following reasons:

a. They took over 45 minutes to serve food
b. The food that was served was taken back immediately stating that it was delivered to the wrong table
c. Taste is a mere OK as the curries lack the 'authentic' Indian flavor.

data.title: Indian food, Halal & Affordable
data.text:
All in the title. 
The food is super tasty. 
Prices are very affordable.
And halal food if it makes any difference for you.

data.title: Great Food in this buzzing little restaurant!
data.text: This place is really good for a fun outing enjoying pakistani/ north indian food. We came here (the four of us) in mid August and were running quite late for dinner and some other indian places were already shut but as soon as we entered we just had to wait few minutes and were seated. If you are in for a lounge quiet fancy place this is not for you. It gets crowded and loud so be ready for good food and crazy atmosphere inside.The staff is friendly and they work really hard to get your food on the table. We ordered palak paneer (which was good), bukhara dal (really tasty), butter chicken (yum), grilled fish (Superb), lamb ghosht which was really good too and biryani. We didn't try the grilled prawns which were supposed to be good but they were already out and sad we didn't try the tandoori chicken which is recommended as well. We paired everything with tandoori rotis and butter garlic naan and plain naan. Food was delish and we all overate ;). I would recommend going easy for dinner if you're not used to this type of food because it can make you feel gassy and heavy since it's quite greasy and full of masalas. Hygiene levels however are quite the ones you find in India so bit disappointing in that regard.

data.title: Best Tandoori I have ever had in Bay Area
data.text: Bit crowded during lunch, but for the taste I would compromise the crowd and ambiance. Briyani is tasty as well. Guests would just pile up Tandoori and eat nothing but Tandoori :)

data.title: Perfect Dum Biryani at Kabob & Curry
data.text:
We were invited by friends and pleasantly surprised at the authenticity of their Lamb Biryani with succulent lamb in a perfect melange of spices, masala, basmati rice with the right fragrance, aroma, taste and portion! I had four sumptuous helpings till I could eat no more. They get a whopping 10.

There were several other dishes ordered but the portions were rather small and were passable compared to the Delhi standard they rate their Biryani.

data.title: Excellent place for non veg food
data.text:
This place is awesome for all its non veg items

All preparations have minimum level of oil in it and its just delicious 

No specific dish but try all its worth the money

data.title: Biryani is awesome
data.text:
I usually order biryani and one other side dish (leg or breast) here. It is "usually" sufficient for two people. There is only one/two instances where I was able to finish full plater of biryani by myself( too much quantity). Back in 2007 when I first tried this place, biryani was in short supply and often would run out of biryani by 6:45 PM (on weekends). However over the years, it seems to have improved and I have ordered as late as 7:35 PM and still got it. 
Long story short, if you plan on coming to this place just for biryani, don't waste time putting on 3 LBS of make up. Plan on being here before 7:00 PM( especially on weekends). 
Anyway I visit this place at least once a month. 
Side note: They used to pack to-go orders in styrofoam boxes before and have recently switched to plastic boxes that can be recycled. Do your part, wash the box after use and put it out for recycling...

data.title: Great hole-in-the-wall, perfect for delicious take-out
data.text: Not much to look at inside, but you'll see the long line for to-go good-- there's always a wait, and once you taste the food, you'll know why.  The Palak Paneer is always excellent, queema naan is great, choley is delicious, anything lamb.  Even the naan is great.  All of the food has great spicy flavors.  Give yourself enough time to call in advance, and prepare to wait in line to pick up your order, but it's worth it!

data.title: Good spicy Indian food
data.text: Tried this one for the second time. If you are in a mood for some tasty kabab and Biriyani, this is the place. Didn't like the ambiance and sitting arrangement. Observed that there is a series of parcels to go. That's the best option I think. We tried Boti kabab, Sheekh Kabab and Lamb Stew this time. They were good.

data.title: Delicious food
data.text: Amazing biryani! Chicken kadai, Chicken/paneer tikka masala and palak paneer are really good. The Naan is really the best! The ambiance is not great but food is tasty as hell!.

data.title: Good pricing and food, questionable cleanliness
data.text:
This is the kind of restaurant that is frequented by traditional Indians and Pakistanis. The food is quite authentic and tasty. I enjoyed the Lamb Biryani although be aware that it contained several bones. The Tandoori Chicken was very tasty and tender. And the Mango Iassi (yoghurt shake) was excellent. The pricing for all items was very reasonable.
However, I'm unsure about the cleanliness of the restaurant. When I walked in, I saw a large spider crawling across the floor. And the men's restroom was quite dirty and unpleasant.

data.title: Authentic food
data.text: I have been to this place twice.  I must say that the dishes taste quite authentic (good gravy flavor for meat dishes).  We ordered Butter chicken and Chicken Korma.  The Chicken korma was absolutely delicious.  The butter chicken was also quite tasty.  In the past we have ordered Tandoori shrimp and found the dish to be well seasoned.  I would recommend this place to those who are looking for chicken that is cooked Hyderabadi style.  The naans are also excellent.  I could have just eaten naan all night long :).  Areas of improvement:  the servers should be careful how they touch the eating utensils (not touch the part that goes into the mouth), parking is tight and seating can be tight during peak hour.  There were a lot of take out orders.  Not sure if they make reservations.

data.title: Great food with pathetic service
data.text:
This restaurant has some exceptionally delicious non-veg curries & tandoor items.
We luved the Kadhai Chicken here. Lamb stew was not for my taste - may be some people may like it.

All this is waste as the service here is pathetic & you have to wait so much time to even place the order. 

In short, do take parcels only & you are on for a yummy meal. :)

data.title: Mixed feelings
data.text:
Had heard of this place from a number of people and so gave it a try. Came out with mixed opinion. 
Their tandoori chicken is very good - a very heady mix of marination, tenderness and juiciness. This item is strongly recommended.
The lamb biryani was however a letdown for us. We were given to understand that this is one of their signature items and available only on limited days, We did not find it appealing - taste wise. Others have commented that the lamb portion is small and we tended to agree.
Hence the overall average rating.

data.title: Great Indian food place
data.text: A friend told me I needed to stop here. Great choice. The food is amazing. I try different things each time and you really can't go wrong here. The Lamb Korma was great. Be sure to get a garlic naan to go with it.

data.title: Very good food
data.text: The smells of the restaurant upon walking in are wonderful are wonderful. My food was excellent. I am here on a business trip, and would come back again waweexcellent.excellent aam here am here

data.title: Awesome experience
data.text:
Me and my husband went to kabab and currys and overall It was a wonderful experience out there . After so many days of Indian food craving we finally got to know about kabab and currys through one of our friend . We got a complete Indian feeling and the food was really awesome .staff was also friendly .I would also like to mention the Mango Lassi, do not forget to drink that.We even heard a lot about biryani but unfortunately it was not available since we got in late .

We had a great time there and wish to visit this place again when we goto states.

data.title: One of the best in the US!
data.text: Great food as always whether be it vegetarian or otherwise. Love the curries. Prices are more than reasonable. One of my favorite places to eat in the US.

data.title: Delicious food
data.text: One of the best places in Bay Area to get delicious biryani. Great food , no doubt about it . But , parking can me tough . I prefer a carry out here instead of dine in .
